Name: LU 726 - Zoning, DOWNTOWN FAR ROCKAWAY DEVELOPMENT PLAN, Queens (C 170248 PPQ)
Title: Resolution approving with modification the decision of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 170248 PPQ, for the disposition of two city-owned properties located on Beach 21st Street, south of Mott Avenue (Block 15705, Lots 59 and 69) and on the northwest corner of Augustina and Nameoke avenues (Block 15534, Lot 70), pursuant to zoning, Community District 14, Borough of Queens (L.U. No. 726).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

\v0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b By Council Members Greenfield and Richards\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on July 10, 2017 its decision dated July 10, 2017 (the "Decision"), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, regarding an application submitted by the Department of Citywide Administrative Services, for the disposition of two city-owned properties located on Beach 21st Street, south of Mott Avenue (Block 15705, Lots 59 and 69) and on the northwest corner of Augustina and Nameoke avenues (Block 15534, Lot 70) (the \ldblquote Disposition Area\rdblquote ), pursuant to zoning.  This disposition, in conjunction with the related actions would facilitate the Downtown Far Rockaway Development Plan, a comprehensive planning, zoning, and redevelopment strategy aimed at supporting Downtown Far Rockaway\rquote s growth and vitality by fostering a vibrant mix of residential, commercial, and community facility uses on vacant and underutilized sites near mass transit resources and along the area\rquote s primary corridors, (Application No. C 170248 PPQ), Community District 14, Borough of Queens (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7560\tx7920\tx8640\tab WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications C\expndtw-4  \expndtw0 170243 (A) ZMQ (L.U. No. 721), a zoning map amendment as modified; N\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 170244\expndtw-2  (A) \expndtw0 ZRQ (L.U. No. 722), a zoning text amendment as modified; N 170245 HGQ (L.U. No. 723), designation of the Downtown Far Rockaway Urban Renewal\expndtw-4  \expndtw0 Area; C\expndtw-3  \expndtw0 170246\expndtw-3  \expndtw0 HUQ (L.U. No. 724), Downtown Far Rockaway Urban Renewal Plan; and C\expndtw-3  170247 HDQ (L.U. No. 725), d\expndtw0 isposition of City-owned property within the Downtown Far Rockaway Urban Renewal Area;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj      \tab WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(3) of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj       \tab WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on July 27, 2017;\par
\par
      \tab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Final Environmental Impact Statement (FEIS) for which a Notice of Completion was issued on June 29, 2017 (CEQR No. 16DME010Q), which identified significant adverse impacts with respect to hazardous materials, air quality and noise which would be avoided  through the placement of (E) designations (E-415) and the Technical Memoranda dated April 26, 2017, and August 31, 2017, (the \ldblquote Technical Memoranda\rdblquote );\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 Having considered the FEIS and the Technical Memorandum with respect to the Decision and Application, the Council finds that:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj  \tab\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj (1)\tab The FEIS meets the requirements of 6 N.Y.C.R.R. Part 617; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080 (2)\tab\tab Consistent with social, economic and other essential considerations, from among the reasonable alternatives thereto, the action is one which minimizes or avoids adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable; and\par
\par
(3)\tab\tab The adverse environmental impacts disclosed in the FEIS will be minimized or avoided to the maximum extent practicable by incorporating as conditions to the approval, those mitigation measures that were identified as practicable; and \par
\par
(4)\tab\tab The Decision, together with the FEIS and the Technical Memorandum, constitute the written statement of facts, and of social, economic and other factors and standards that form the basis of this determination, pursuant to 6 N.Y.C.R.R. \'a7617.11(d).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tqc\tx4320\tqr\tx8640 Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 170248 PPQ, incorporated by reference herein, the Council approves the Decision with a modification to \uldb remove Block 15534, Lot 70 from the Disposition Area and approve the disposition of Block 15705, Lots 59 and 69.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qc\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720 Adopted.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx720\par
Office of the City Clerk, \}\par

\par
